alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 8:38PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Elbert, central Arapahoe, and central Adams Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 837 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Denver International Airport to 6 miles south of Elbert, or along a line extending from 22 miles northeast of Denver to 23 miles northeast of Colorado Springs. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Aurora, Elbert, Bennett, Elizabeth, Kiowa, Watkins, Byers, Manila Village, Strasburg and Ponderosa Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
